text: now Pakistan has said it plans to take
action against militant groups operating
on its soil after global pressure to act
after a suicide bomber killed 40 Indian
soldiers last month the attack triggered
a military response from India then
retaliation from Pakistan pushing the
nuclear neighbors to the brink of war
tension has eased with the release of
the captured Indian pilot on Friday
now the Express train service between
the two countries has restarted after
being suspended during the standoff so
couldn't Kimani reports now from
Islamabad over the weekend tensions
between Pakistan and India seem to have
greatly reduced whilst there were a
number of casualties from cross-border
shelling on Friday night the situation
along the line of control now seems a
lot calmer
although there are still exchanges of
fire all the main airports here are now
open in the train service between Lahore
and Delhi is resuming today they've been
reports that the Pakistani authorities
are planning a crackdown on militant
groups in the country by focusing on
freezing their assets those groups would
include Jesse Mohammed which claimed
responsibility for the suicide attack
which sparked this crisis but we've
heard similar things before and
Pakistani officials seem to be saying
that this decision was taken before this
conflict erupted so I think at least
initially there'll be a degree of
skepticism about how far they're willing
to go meanwhile in India there been
reports that the founder of Jasher
Mohammed Masood other has died but
according to our sources that's not true
this crisis seems to be dissipating but
the underlying causes behind it
including genuine local grievances in
indian-administered Kashmir and alleged
Pakistani links to militant groups still
remain that was segundo Kimani
